what: Visualizing Statistics on Images in R
title: Visualizing Statistics on Images in R
text: Live-cell microscopy become essential tool analyzing dynamic processes various biological applications. critically assess influence individual cells calculated summary statistics, detect heterogeneous cell populations possible confounding factors, misclassified -tracked objects, direct mapping gained statistical information onto actual image data necessary. VisuStatR allows visualize time-resolved motility parameters summary statistic onto images R. Originally, package intended used live-cell microscopy images cell-tracking data. general VisuStatR can used kind data supplying dataframe trackIds, time spatial coordinates (2D/3D), well numeric discrete mapping parameters corresponding images.

what: Intention and concept of the software tool
title: Visualizing Statistics on Images in R
text: VisuStatR especially designed experimentalists non-expert users allow visual inspection tracking imaging data. package perform automatic image analysis object tracking . rather allows combined visualization raw imaging data calculated summary statistics explain specific characteristics evaluate possible artifacts. Thereby, supports imaging tracking software, FiJi/TrackMate (Schindelin et al., Nat. Meth. 2012, Berg et al. Nat. Meth. 2019), analysis tools, CelltrackR (Wortel et al., ImmunoInf. 2021), allowing combined visualization individual outputs within raw image data. end, VisuStatR able select zoom-specific objects tracks using different display modes. Concepts VisuStatR input VisuStatR requires: + original stacks 2D/3D images analyzed (VisuStatR supporting tiff, png, jpeg image format supported magick library) + obtained tracking data + summary statistics evaluated image data + using Shiny app tracking data summary statistics need supplied csv-file package acts wrapper annotating provided images several, modifiable ggplot2-layers. visustat_frame(), continous discrete parameters can mapped individually color, shape size one timepoint. visustat_summary() allows create corresponding plot given statistics whole range provided data. time-resolved image-series can created visustat_all() allows combine mapped frames summary plots created visustat_frame() visustat_summary(). output functions ggplot2-objects can manipulated common manner.

title: Visualizing Statistics on Images in R
text: VisuStatR allows several display modes. common shown complete image captured one continuous parameter mapped track color. addition, also possible map discrete variables shape /color continuous variables size /alpha. example, contact-state infection-status tracked cells mapped color shape. Mapping contact state infection state

title: Visualizing Statistics on Images in R
text: output-type visustat_frame() can combined output visustat_summary(). Output visustat_frame() combined visustat_summary()

title: Visualizing Statistics on Images in R
text: output visustat_frame() need whole image. can cropped manually automatically create sub-windows allow follow individual tracks, might interesting due prior performed statistical analysis highlighted example outliers. Sub-window output

title: Visualizing Statistics on Images in R
text: VisuStatR supports tiff-stacks 3D image data input. Since ggplot2 just works 2D, user can choose different Z-projections view data 2D. output modes work 3D-image data. addition, possible follow several individual tracks respective Z-axis parallel.

title: Visualizing Statistics on Images in R
text: addition functionality R-package, VisuStatR can completely used within Shiny-app calling visustat_shiny(). Shiny-app acts graphical-user interface allows import prepare tracking image data well process VisuStatR functionalities. contrast using VisuStatR IDE terminal, Shiny-app adds much interactive way data-analysis allows users proficient R language process data VisuStatR. Shiny screenshot

title: Visualizing Statistics on Images in R
text: VisuStatR developed R-package version 4.0.4 requires previous installation R (https://cran.r-project.org). depends R packages tidyverse, ggplot2, plotly, Rmisc, cowplot, doSNOW, facetscales, foreach, ggecho, grid, gridExtra, magick, parallel, shiny, shinydashboard rlang. packages available CRAN need installed via devtools installation VisuStatR. includes facetscales ggecho. VisuStatR installed directly GitHub via following command: information individual functions required inputs can found within documentation https://grrchrr.github.io/VisuStatR/reference/index.html.
code: # If devtools is not already installed: install.packages(“devtools”)  # install dependencies which are not found on CRAN devtools::install_github("zeehio/facetscales") remotes::install_github("coolbutuseless/ggecho") # install VisuStatR from git repo devtools::install_git("https://github.com/grrchrr/VisuStatR")

visustat_all — visustat_all
text: Creates time-resolved images series tracking data modifiable parameter mapping. visustat_all wrapper function visustat_frame visustat_summary. User parameters functions can passed via lists visustat_frame.list visustat_summary.list.

title: visustat_all — visustat_all
code: visustat_all(   df,   images,   stack = FALSE,   frame_range = NULL,   display_frame = TRUE,   display_summary = FALSE,   visustat_frame.list = NULL,   visustat_summary.list = NULL,   save = TRUE,   file_name = NULL,   width = 2000,   height = 1200,   rel_width = 0.66,   browse = FALSE,   return = FALSE )

title: visustat_all — visustat_all
text: df dataframe form: df(track, time, X, Y, mapping_parameters, ...) images vector: filenames images ordered frames/time frame_range integer: frames mapped; default=NULL maps full time/frame range found df display_frame logical: display output visustat_frame display_summary logical: display output visustat_summary visustat_frame.list list: parameters passed visustat_frame visustat_summary.list list: parameters passed visustat_summary save logical: saves tiff-stack image ./output/visustatr-date.tiff width numeric: width output tiff pixels height numeric: height output tiff pixels rel_width numeric: (display_frame & display_summary), rel_width defines relative width summary plot mapped frame browse logical: browse output default system application tiffs, e.g. imageJ return logical: return images-series magick image-stack

title: visustat_all — visustat_all
code: # import tracking data data(hiv_motility) # get image files images <- hiv_motility_images() # run visustatR with default settings visustat_all(hiv_motility, images, save=FALSE) #> Started VisuStatR: 2022-02-26 14:55:04 #> frame_range not specified, defaulting to maximal frame range found in dataset #> Running visustat_frame()... #> Finished analysis: 2022-02-26 14:55:57 #> Creating image stacks... #> Done. #> Deleted temp_files. # run visustatR with visustat_frame and visustat_summary tracks <- c(34, 125, 199, 205) summary_pars <- list(par.map='angle', time.unit='min', tracks=tracks) frame_pars <- list(par.map='angle', par.shape='type', tracks=tracks) visustat_all(hiv_motility,  images,  frame_range = c(1,10),  display_summary = 1,  visustat_frame.list = frame_pars,  visustat_summary.list = summary_pars,  file_name = 'hiv_tracking_angle',  save=FALSE  ) #> Started VisuStatR: 2022-02-26 14:56:05 #> Running visustat_summary()... #> Running visustat_frame()... #> Finished analysis: 2022-02-26 14:57:03 #> Creating image stacks... #> Done. #> Deleted temp_files.

title: visustat_check — visustat_check
text: Gives summary allows check linking passed dataframe  images frame-wise manner.

title: visustat_check — visustat_check
text: df dataframe form: df(track, time, X, Y, (Z,) mapping_parameters, ...) images vector: filenames images ordered frames/time dimensions numeric: specify whether images 2D 3D. 3D selected data assumed form: df(track, time, X, Y, Z, mapping paramters, ...) stack logical: default: FALSE, single image file provided time-resolved imagestack used, set: TRUE

title: visustat_check — visustat_check
code: data(hiv_motility) images <- hiv_motility_images() visustat_check(hiv_motility, images) #> Same number of images as timepoints in the dataset. #> # A tibble: 15 × 3 #>     time frame image                                                             #>    <dbl> <int> <chr>                                                             #>  1     2     3 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #>  2     3     4 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #>  3     4     5 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #>  4     5     6 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #>  5     6     7 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #>  6     7     8 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #>  7     8     9 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #>  8     9    10 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #>  9    10    11 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #> 10    11    12 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #> 11    12    13 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #> 12    13    14 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #> 13    14    15 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #> 14     0     1 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt… #> 15     1     2 /private/var/folders/cf/074kcbdn6_5879bsv0hg2qh00000gn/T/Rtmpfjt…

title: visustat_frame — visustat_frame
text: visustat_frame, continuous discrete parameters can mapped individually color, shape size one timepoint.

title: visustat_frame — visustat_frame
text: df dataframe form: df(track, time, X, Y, (Z,) mapping_parameters, ...) image character: filename image stack logical: default: FALSE, single image file provided time-resolved imagestack used, set: TRUE image.depth numeric: set image bit-depth; just important Z-projections calculated image.normalize logical: normalize image frame integer: frame mapped tracks vector: defining tracks displayed par.map character: specifying parameter df visualized color par.shape character: specifying parameter df mapped shape par.display display option mapping; default: TRUE, mapping disable : FALSE par.max numeric: defining upper range color mapping par.min numeric: defining lower range color mapping par.unit character: unit numeric mapped parameter crop logical: option cropping images; default: FALSE sub.img logical: option creating sub-images specified tracks pre-filtered df; default: FALSE sub.window numeric: size sub-images pixels sub.col numeric: number columns sub-images arranged tracks.size numeric: size tracks tracks.alpha numeric: transparency tracks tracks.length numeric: length tracks (frames) tracks.label logical: sub.img used, display hide track label tracks.label.x numeric: sub.img used, set x-position label tracks.label.y numeric: sub.img used, set y-position label points.size numeric: size points points.alpha numeric: transparency points points.stat character: display statistic; default: 'echo', blurring; without blurring 'identity' points.shape numeric: set shape ggplot2 shape palette axis.tick numeric: axis ticks px axis.display logical: display axis axis.labs logical: display labs unit character: setting name unit; default: 'px' scaling numeric: scaling factor unit; default: 1 dimensions numeric: specify whether images 2D 3D. 3D selected data assumed form: df(track, time, X, Y, Z, mapping paramters, ...) manual.z numerice: specify Z-plane visualized projection sub windows used scale.bar logical: show scalebar; default: FALSE scale.width numeric: width scalebar; default: 40 scale.height numeric: height scalebar; default: 10 scale.x numeric: distance left border image towards scalebar scale.y numeric: distance bottom border image towards scalebar scale.color character: specify color R-color palette hexcode interactive logical: return plot interactive plotly object. supported using sub.img crop modes.

title: visustat_frame — visustat_frame
text: returns ggplot2 plot-object can modified

title: visustat_frame — visustat_frame
code: # import hiv motility tracking data data('hiv_motility') # get image files images <- hiv_motility_images() # run visustat_frame with default settings visustat_frame(hiv_motility, image=images[15], frame=15, image.normalize=1) #> par.map not specified #> defaulted to: speed  #> assuming: df(track, time, X, Y, mapping_parameters, ...)  # run visustat_frame with specified settings visustat_frame(hiv_motility,    image = images[15],    frame = 15,    tracks = c(48, 66, 102, 108),    sub.img = TRUE,    sub.col = 2,    sub.window= 300,    par.map ='speed',    par.shape ='type',    points.size=2,    image.normalize=1  )  # import clonogenic assay colony growth data data('clonogenic_assay') # get image files images <- clonogenic_assay_images() # run visustat_frame with default settings visustat_frame(clonogenic_assay, image=images[15], frame=15, tracks.length=0, axis.display=0) #> par.map not specified #> defaulted to: Area  #> assuming: df(track, time, X, Y, mapping_parameters, ...)   # import subcellular particle data data('subcellular_particle_dynamics') # get image files images <- subcellular_particle_dynamics_images() visustat_frame(subcellular_particle_dynamics,  image=images[2], frame=2,  tracks.length=0,  axis.display=0,  par.map='MEAN_INTENSITY') + scale_color_viridis_c(option='plasma') #> Scale for 'colour' is already present. Adding another scale for 'colour', #> which will replace the existing scale.

what: VisuStatR: Visualizing Motility Parameters on Images in R — visustat-package
title: VisuStatR: Visualizing Motility Parameters on Images in R — visustat-package
text: VisustatR allows visualize time-resolved motility parameters summary statistic onto images R. Originally package intended used live-cell microscopy image tracking data, can used kind data supplying dataframe track Ids, time, X Y coordinates, well numeric discrete mapping parameters corresponding images.

title: VisuStatR: Visualizing Motility Parameters on Images in R — visustat-package
VisuStatR: Visualizing Motility Parameters on Images in R — visustat-package
text: allows map (time-resolved) motility parameters calcuclated summary statistic based coordinates back corresponding image data. package acts wrapper annotating provided images several, modifiable ggplot2-layers.     visustat_frame, continous discrete parameters can mapped individually color, shape size one timepoint. visustat_summary() allows create corresponding plot given statistics whole range provided data.     time-resolved image-series can created visustat_all allows combine mapped frames summary plots created visustat_frame visustat_summary. ouput functions ggplot2-objects can manipulated common manner.     functionalties can also accessed via Shiny app calling visustat_shiny

title: visustat_shiny — visustat_shiny
text: visustat_shiny, can run functionalities VisuStatR package shiny app.

title: visustat_summary — visustat_summary
text: visustat_summary, time-resolved summary statistics calculated. correspondence visustat_frame continuous discrete parameters can mapped individually color shape.  addition, population mean either standard deviations, confidence intervals standard errors respective statistics can displayed facetted ribbon plots.

title: visustat_summary — visustat_summary
text: df dataframe form: df(track, time, X, Y, mapping_parameters, ...) frame integer: frame mapped time.unit character: time unit tracks vector: defining tracks displayed par.map character: specifying parameter df visualized color par.shape character: specifying parameter df mapped shape ribbon logical: display ribbon ribbon.stat character: choose ribbon-statistic: 'sd': standard deviation, 'se': standard error, 'ci': confidence interval line.size numeric: size lines line.alpha numeric: transparency lines line.length numeric: length lines (frames) points.size numeric: size points points.alpha numeric: transparency points points.shape numeric: set shape ggplot2 shape palette unit character: setting name unit; default: 'px'

title: visustat_summary — visustat_summary
code: data(hiv_motility) visustat_summary(hiv_motility %>% na.omit(), par.map="speed", tracks=c(48, 66, 102, 108)) #> frame not specified, defaulting to latest frame in dataset: 10 #> Warning: pars.numeric not specified, assuming the parameters to be: speed, angle, arrest, rmsd, straight #> Warning: `rename_()` was deprecated in dplyr 0.7.0. #> Please use `rename()` instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was generated. #> Warning: `mutate_()` was deprecated in dplyr 0.7.0. #> Please use `mutate()` instead. #> See vignette('programming') for more help #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was generated.
